title: We Are the Daleks
author: Jonathan Morris
filename: 201 - We Are the Daleks - Jonathan Morris_djvu.txt

elements.text: PART ONE
PRE-TITLES:
1: EXT. LONDON STREET. 1987.
FX: PEDESTRIANS CHATTING. CONSTANT TRAFFIC. A CAR PASSES WITH
80S MUSIC BLASTING. (SOMETHING LIKE “JACK MIX II”)
FX: TARDIS LANDS, DOOR OPENS.
(EMERGING) Threadneedle Street, the City of London!
(EMERGING) And the year?
(SNIFFS, AS THOUGH WINE TASTING) 1987. Early October.
One year in my future.
I’d avoid bumping into anybody you know. That could lead to some awkward conversations. But apart from that, you should find everything’s pretty much as you left it.
Oh, I wouldn’t say that.
(FX: CLOSING TARDIS DOOR) No?
That office block over there, that’s new. And doesn’t it remind you of anything?
Now that you mention it. Tapering walls of steel and glass. With regular hemispherical protrusions.
With a slatted mid-section and a dome on top. It’s a Dalek! A skyscraper slap-bang in the heart of London... in the shape of a Dalek!
MUSIC: OPENING THEME
WE ARE THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 3
2: INT. SPACESHIP.
FX: SPACESHIP WHOOSHES PAST, ENGINES BLAZING. INSIDE, IT HUMS
WITH POWER. INSTRUMENTS BLEEP.
(VIA RADIO) Entering gamma quadrant. Rebel-held space.
FX: INTERCOM ACTIVATED.
Commander Mel, calling all Hawk-ships. Set force-shields to maximum and scan for enemy vessels.
(VIA RADIO) Yes, Commander. Scanning meteoroid cluster. (FX: WARNING BLEEPS) Five enemy ships detected, Eagle class!
Co-ordinates?
(VIA RADIO) Two ahead, three behind. We’ve flown into an ambush!
FX: SPACESHIP HIT, SHUDDER.
(VIA RADIO) Shields down to sixty per-cent!
Prepare for warp-jump.
(VIA RADIO) We can’t, not in a meteoroid cluster. (FX: SPACESHIP HIT) Shields down to twenty per-cent.
FX: TWO EXPLOSIONS VIA MONITOR.
(VIA RADIO) Two Hawk-Ships destroyed! They’re picking us off, one by one!
We'll have to split up, I’1l try to draw them away.
(VIA RADIO) We don’t stand a chance. Our shields are down. One more hit, and we’re done for!
FX: WARNING SIREN.
Launch escape capsules.
WE ARE THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 4
(VIA RADIO) It’s too late, (Mel) —
FX: RADIO DISSOLVES INTO STATIC. MEL HITS BUTTONS.
Commander Brinsley. Commander Brinsley, respond!
FX: ENEMY LASERS. SPACESHIP HIT, SHUDDER, EXPLOSIONS.
Oh no. Now it’s only me left. Five against one. Well, if I’m going to die, I’m going to take them with me. Energy bomb!
FX: BLEEPING OF BOMB COUNTDOWN. LASERS, EXPLOSIONS. ABRUPTLY
CUT OFF BY ‘GAME OVER’ JINGLE OF COMPUTER GAME.
WE ARE THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 5
3: INT. COMPUTER ROOM. (CONTINUOUS
FX: FANS KEEPING COMPUTERS COOL. OCCASIONAL PIPE GURGLE.
‘Fairly adequate’. What sort of a score is that?
Not bad for a beginner. You had them on the run for a while there.
FX: MEL GETS UP, RETURNS TO HER DESK.
I can see why you spend so much time playing it.
Beats sitting around waiting for someone to phone us with their problems.
You could always do something more constructive, like reading a book.
Reading a book verses playing Warfleet, the most realistic computer game ever? Not much of a contest!
You call that realistic?
Admittedly they shouldn’t be called meteoroids, they’re asteroids, but apart from that, it’s totally convincing.
(TO HERSELF) If you have nothing to compare it to. (TO BRINSLEY) Anyway, lunch break over, back to work.
FX: MEL TAPPING AT COMPUTER KEYBOARD. BLEEPS.
What’s that you’re doing? That’s the company accounts! Aren’t they confidential?
I’m just debugging the sorting algorithm, that’s all.
Oh, I suppose that’s alright then...
FX: PHONE RINGS TWICE.
WE ARE THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 6
Brinsley, are you going to answer that?
You’re the boss, you’re the first point of contact.
Fine, fine. (FX: ANSWERS PHONE) Hello, I.T. (BEAT) Have you tried turning it off and on again?
MUSIC LINK.
WE ARE THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 7
4: EXT. RIVERSIDE RESTAURANT.
FX: OCCASIONAL RIVER TRAFFIC. OTHER CUSTOMERS IN B/G.
ARRIVING) Ah, Mel. Sorry I’m late. (FX: PUTS DOWN BAG
Doctor! What do you look like?!
(FX: PULLS UP CHAIR, SITS) I’m blending in.
Blending in?
As a young-ish, upwardly-mobile professional.
I suppose I should be grateful you stopped at the red braces, and didn’t get an ear-ring.
I knew there was something I’d forgotten. It’s important to look the part.
Of an overgrown public schoolboy?
Of a stock market broker. I deal in futures.
(AMUSED) What else?
Just give me a moment to get my personal organiser. (FX:
THUMPS ON TABLE) So, Mel, what have you got for me?
As you know, the building is the Zenos Tower, headquarters of the Zenos Corporation. Named after the mysterious Alek Zenos.
Why mysterious?
Because he never leaves his office on the top floor, and he only deals with the great and the good. He’s not even named in the accounts.
Interesting.
WE ARE THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 8
He seems to have risen without trace over the last few years, becoming head of his own media empire.
Anything else?

(FX: HANDS OVER PAPER BAG) These are the company accounts, all copied onto floppy disc. They’ve been buying up newspapers, publishers, radio stations. All through an intricate network of dummy companies to avoid the attention of the Monopolies and Mergers Commission.
Most useful. I’ve made some inquiries myself, on the stock market. There is some concern about the Zenos Corporation.
Why?
Because, aS you Said, Zenos have come from nowhere. For all anyone knows they’re just another stock market bubble getting ready to burst.
Except we know they do have backing. From the Daleks.
Have you seen them, Mel?
In the tower? No.
No. This isn’t like the Daleks at all. And that makes me nervous.
Which makes me nervous.
So, Mel, anything else about this time that’s different?
Well, there’s Warfleet, that’s new.
Warfleet?
WE ARE THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 9
5: INT. COMPUTER ROOM. [FLASHBACK]
FX: GAME IN B/G, DISC DRIVES WHIRRING. DOOR OPENS.
Brinsley, what are you doing?
FX: GAME SILENCED.
Nothing, Miss Bush, just... programming.
Playing a computer game at work? I could have you fired.
Are you going to?
No. Count yourself lucky that it’s my first day. What is this game, anyway?
Warfleet. It’s a new console, only came out a few weeks ago. It’s well wicked.
What’s so ‘wicked’ about it?
You get to fly a spaceship, go on missions.
(UNIMPRESSED) Oh.
But that’s not all. You link up with other players over the phone using modems, so you all play at once.
In different spaceships?
Right, but flying together. You’d love it.
I doubt it’s my sort of thing.
It’s nearly time for lunch anyway. Go on. Live a little.
Oh, alright then. (FX: WHEELS UP CHAIR) Budge up...
WE ARE THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 10
FX: BRINSLEY RESTARTS GAME. OUT OF FLASHBACK TO:
WE ARE THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 11
6: EXT. RIVERSIDE RESTAURANT. (CONTINUOUS
Interesting. It sounds a little ahead of its time.
It’s way in advance of anything around when I left. But you should really talk to my colleague Brinsley Heaton, he’s the expert.
(FX: JOTS NOTE IN FILOFAX) ‘Brinsley Heaton’ .. You don’t like to play computer games, Mel?
I don’t like to be the sort of person who plays computer games.
So, this game is an anachronism. Is there any connection to the Zenos Corporation?
They own the factory that makes the consoles. “UltraMega Tech”.
Which surely can’t be a coincidence. Well done, Mel. I — Are you wearing something different?
I was wondering how long it would take you to notice.
I don’t like to be the sort of person who cares about what people are wearing.
It’s for tonight. Alek Zenos is holding a VIP reception in the penthouse suite.
And you managed to procure an invitation?
No, but dressed like this, is anyone going to turn me away?
I admire your initiative, Mel. But if Alek Zenos is working for who we think he’s working for —
I know. I’1l1 be careful.
Don’t take any chances. I’1l meet you here, same time tomorrow.
WE ARE THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 12
Anything I should be looking for in particular?
Anything out of the ordinary. I tried scanning the Tower but it just came up as a normal office block. They must be using some sort of cloaking pattern.
Either that or it is just a normal office block.
(LAUGHS) Well, I suppose we shouldn’t rule out any possibility — no matter how far-fetched.
What about you?
I have these discs to keep me busy. Good luck, Mel.
See you tomorrow. (LEAVING)
So. Warfleet...
MUSIC LINK.
WE ARE THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 13
7: TV NEWS MONTAGE
FX: FADE UP.

. Celia Dunthorpe, the newly-elected independent MP for Pottersbridge, has invited MPs from all sides of the political spectrum to join her cross-party reform group, the ‘United Modernists’. Responding to critics who have described the group as a vehicle for her own personal ambitions, Mrs Dunthorpe said: “Ambition is not a dirty word.”
FX: IN B/G, A RECORDING OF A RIOT WITH EXPLOSIONS, POLICE CAR
SIRENS.
In other news. Violent demonstrations outside the Ultramega Tech Factory look set to continue. We go over live to our reporter at the scene, Serena Paget.
FX: WE CROSS TO SCENE — WHISTLES AND HORNS BUT NO RIOT.

You join me outside the factory gates, now closed to its former employees, dismissed without notice. The union is demanding the workforce be reinstated, but the Ultramega Tech management are refusing to negotiate. The result is a stand-off between pickets and police, who, as you can see, are prepared for another night of unrest. I have with me Frank Lewis, who has been leading the protest.
All we're asking for is our jobs back. We’ve been laid off without pay, without reason. All we want is a deal.
But what about the attacks on the police?
This was a peaceful demonstration, before the police started dragging people off and arresting them —
So you don’t condemn the attacks?
I condemn any acts of violence, on all sides.
Thank you. This is Serena Paget, at the Ultramega Tech Factory in Bradford.
WE ARE THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 14
WE ARE THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 15
8: EXT. ROAD OUTSIDE FACTORY. (CONTINUOUS
FX: A FAIR WAY AWAY — PICKETS GATHERED AROUND BRAZIERS, POLICE
SNORTING.
(SINGING) We shall, we shall not be moved... [ETC, DIES AWAY]
(VIA LOUDHAILER) Move along there. I said, move along...!
We’re clear? Good. I don’t suppose anyone could find me a coffee?
(SUDDENLY BESIDE HER) I can’t offer you a coffee, Ms Paget —
(STARTING) What? Where did you— [spring from? ]
. but I can offer you an exclusive.
Who are you?
You know this factory was taken over by the Zenos Corporation earlier this year?
I’ve heard rumours, but —
And doesn’t it intrigue you, that just after all the workers were laid off, this factory was used to manufacture a new game console?
Why should that intrigue me?
Because you’re a journalist. The question you should be asking is this: Why are they so keen to keep it secret?
Alright then. Why?
I don’t know. I was hoping you might help me find out.
If she won’t help you, I will.
WE ARE THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 16
That’s very kind of you —
Frank. Until a few weeks ago, I was the shop steward.
And now you lead the picket line.
You can’t just lay people off overnight. These men have wives and kids to support.
Never mind the politics, you said you could help me.
You’re not the only one who wants to know what’s going on in there. They say they’ve automated the production line but nobody’s seen anything being taken in. No machines, nothing.
No?
The only things that get in are empty lorries — which come out again with full loads.
What about raw materials?
Nothing.
(INCREDULOUS) But they must be getting the parts from somewhere
Quite the mystery, isn’t it? Well? Is your curiosity piqued, Serena Paget?
We'd have to get inside, take a proper look.
Not a problem. I still have the keys to the back gate.
You’ve never thought to look before?
Never had a reporter with me before. And whoever you are.
WE ARE THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 17
Me? Oh, I’m just an interested party. Call me the Doctor.
WE ARE THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 18
9: INT. DOWNSTAIRS RECEPTION/LIFT
FX: GUESTS MILLING ABOUT.
For goodness’ sake, man, don’t you know who I am? Celia Dunthorpe. M.P. for Pottersbridge.
(COMING OVER) Ignore the idiot security man, Celia. You can cut in with me.
Niles! Thought this might be your sort of thing.
I should cocoa! A chance to press the flesh of Alek Zenos, the enigmatic multi-millionaire. I heard he started out selling suntan lotion.
I heard he started out selling stuffed vine leaves from the back O£ a cart.
Either way, seems very much our kind of person. Maybe even a potential party donor.
Even though you know nothing about him.
I’m sorry, I don’t believe we’ve been introduced...
Melanie Bush.
OF s.?
Time and Related Disciplines Incorporated.
Ah, I see, how... delightful. Bunbury.
What?
Niles Bunbury. M.P. for Tilmouth-on-Sea. P.P.S. to the S.O.S. for the D.O.E.
WE ARE THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 19
Of course, I’ve seen you on television. I remember you were very impressive.
Oh, do you really think so? That’s most kind, I must say, you’re a quite charming young lady yourself...
FX: GUESTS CHATTER AS THEY ARE LED IN.
Niles, the queue’s moving. At last! (OFF, TO SECURITY) I’m Celia Dunthorpe. As well you know.
The thing is, Niles —
Leave it to me. (TO SECURITY) Niles Bunbury. This is Melanie Bush, she’s my ‘plus one’.
Quick, Niles, before the elevator goes.
FX: THEY SQUEEZE IN, HUBBUB AROUND THEM.
Honestly, the bureaucracy.
FX: LIFT DOOR CLOSES. THEY RISE.
(QUIETLY) Honestly, my name should’ve been on the list —
Don’t worry about that. Can’t have a pretty thing like you left out in the cold, can we?
No.
It’s alright. I’m an old hand, I’1l take you under my wing. Now, let’s see what this shindig has to say for itself, shall we?
FX: LIFT DOOR OPENS. DALEKS GLIDE UP TO THEM.
SMALL GASP OF SURPRISE
Welcome! Welcome! Welcome!
10: INT. FACTORY STOREROOM.
WE ARE THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 20
FX: DOOR IS WRENCHED OPEN. ECHO ON VOICES AND FOOTSTEPS.
It’s deserted.
Let’s not jump to any conclusions.
FX: CLATTER AND CREAK OF SHELVES LADEN WITH PARTS.
Watch out, you’1ll have the whole lot down on us. The assembly workshop’s through here.
FX: TRIES DOOR.
Be careful. Be very careful.
What are you talking about? What are you expecting?
The worst. Okay, Frank. Open the door. Slowly.
Right —
FX: FRANK OPENS DOOR. WHIRR OF CONVEYOR BELT AND LOW RUMBLE OF
GENERATORS.
But.. there’s just a conveyor belt. No workers, no automation, nothing.
A conveyor belt carrying copies of the Warfleet game console. But where are they coming from?
What are you on about?
Look.
FX: THEY APPROACH AN AREA OF FIZZLING ALIEN ELECTRICITY.
What is that? Some kind of laser light show?
A fuzzy blue archway... leading to nowhere.
WE ARE THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 21
That’s where the games are coming from. A time corridor.
A what?
They’re being manufactured on another world, possibly in another time.
You think they’re being made by aliens?
Very possibly.
Well, that would explain why they’re not part of the union.
(SUDDEN) Get down, both of you!
FX: WHIRR OF APPROACHING DALEKS.
(WHISPER) What are those things?
(WHISPER) Daleks!
Distribution vehicles have arrived.
We must supervise collection. Humans are unreliable.
I obey.
FX: DALEKS GLIDE AWAY.
WE ARE THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris (FINAL)
11: INT. PENTHOUSE SUITE.
Page 22
FX: MILLING ABOUT, CHATTER, GLASSES CLINK, OCCASIONAL POPS OF
CHAMPAGNE.
Would you like some vol au vents?
No, not right now, thank you.
FX: DALEK WHIRRS AWAY.
What are those things? Robots?
(LAUGHING) Either that or there are little men inside, pushing
them around on casters.
I wouldn’t get too close if I were you.
Why not? They’re rather amusing. Like Metal Mickey!
Or Dusty Bin!
Those attachments on the front, I think one weapon.
What on Earth makes you think that?
FX: DALEK WHIRRS UP TO HER.
Would you like a prawn cocktail?
No, really, I had a big lunch.
FX: DALEK EYESTALK MOVES.
Your appearance does not register.
What?
Who are you? Identify!
of them might be a
WE ARE THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 23
Not again. She’s my guest. Melanie Bush.
(AS THOUGH NOTING NAME) Melanie Bush.
FX: A HUSH FALLS OVER THE ROOM. DALEK WHIRRS AWAY.
Welcome, ladies and gentlemen. My name is Alek Zenos.
FX: LIGHT APPLAUSE.
Thankyou, too kind. Welcome to the Zenos Tower, home of the Zenos Corporation. I’m here as a representative, of a.. foreign power. Allow me to introduce... the Daleks!
FX: DALEKS WHIRR.
They’re called Daleks! Oh, how sweet!
When I say foreign power, that is something of an understatement. You may find this hard to believe, but the Daleks come from another planet.
FX: POLITE LAUGHTER.
You’re right to be sceptical. But please hear me out. They are the force behind the Zenos Corporation. And I — on their behalf — have gathered you here to make you a business proposition.
Go on. We’re all ears.
FX: CHEESY CORPORATE PRESENTATION BACKING MUSIC.
The world is changing. In the next century, Earth will no longer exist in glorious isolation. It will be competing amongst hundreds, thousands of other worlds in the intergalactic market.
I do believe the fellow is as mad as a March hare.
I’m very much afraid he isn’t.
WE ARE THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 24
If the Earth is going to compete, it will need to attract investment. And that’s what the Daleks are offering. Financial investment.
FX: CHEESY MUSIC ENDS.
In the planet Earth?
No. Not the Earth. The United Kingdom. The offer is for your country to have favoured-nation status. The Daleks will deal with the UK, and the UK will act on behalf of the Earth.
(NOT TAKING IT SERIOUSLY) As a sort of middle-man?
Only one country can act as humanity’s shop-window, and you are, after all, a nation of shopkeepers.
FX: POLITE LAUGHTER.
Just to play along for a moment, what is the nature of this investment?
A good question. They offer their expertise, their technical know-how. The UK will become a hotbed of scientific research. But that’s not all. The Daleks offer a cheap, secure supply of energy.
No more having to deal with trade unions and oil sheikhs!
FX: POLITE LAUGHTER.
Quite. In short, they offer the UK an economic miracle. A golden age, yours for the taking.
And what do they want in return?

A cultural exchange. Through the Zenos Corporation, they want to invest in the UK’s media outlets. After all, the UK is the country of Shakespeare, Gainsborough and Elgar. Our history and culture are amongst our greatest assets. — This, ladies and gentlemen, is once-in-a-lifetime opportunity. A partnership with another species!
WE ARE THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 25
FX: POLITE APPLAUSE. DALEKS WHIRR AROUND, CHANTING:
Daleks invest and return! Daleks invest and return!
WE ARE THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 26
12: EXT. FACTORY YARD.
FX: WORKERS LOADING UP LORRIES AS OTHERS DRIVE AWAY. FRANK,
SERENA AND DOCTOR WATCH FROM A DISTANCE.
(OFF) Workers will continue loading!
They’re just loading up the boxes, no questions asked.
You’d think they’d ask a few questions, working for those... things.
With three million on the dole? You can always find scabs willing to cross a picket line.
Mr Lewis, we have far more to worry about than industrial relations.
Doctor, what exactly are these “Daleks”?
An unimaginably cruel and ruthless race, bred for war. Their only goal is the total extermination of all rival species.
So what are they doing in Bradford?
FX: A DALEK GLIDING IN FROM OFF.
Nothing good, we can be sure of — Frank, get down!
What?
Intruders detected. Exterminate! (FX: FIRES)
They’ve spotted us. Run! Ruuun!
FX: DOCTOR, FRANK AND SERENA RUN. 2 X DALEKS FIRE AFTER THEM,
ALL AROUND!
2 X DALEKS: Seek, locate, exterminate! Seek, locate, exterminate!
WE ARE THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 27
13: INT. PENTHOUSE SUITE.
FX: GUEST CHATTER, DALEKS GLIDING ABOUT.
Would you like some champagne?
Cheers. (FX: DALEK POURS DRINK) I still don’t believe a word of it. Any minute now, the top of one of those things is going to pop up, with Jeremy Beadle inside.
I’m not sure. Whether or not they’re aliens, Mr Zenos was talking a lot of common sense.
(JOINING THEM) I’m glad you thought so.. Mrs Dunthorpe.
Niles was just saying, he thinks this is all a prank.
Rather an elaborate one. Don’t worry, I’11 soon lay to rest any doubts you may have... And who is this?
My name’s Mel. Melanie Bush.
I don’t recall that name being on the guest list. My secretary must have added you. Delighted to have the unexpected pleasure of your company, Mel.
FX: DALEK APPROACHES.
Alek Zenos. You are required.
Terribly sorry, if you’1l excuse me. (LEAVES)
WE ARE THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 28
14: INT. ZENOS TOWER CONTROL ROOM.
FX: HUM AND BLEEP OF COMPUTERS. DOOR SLIDES OPEN.
Well, what is it?
Intruders have been detected in the Bradford importation centre.
What? Strikers causing trouble?
They have not yet been identified.
If they’ve seen what’s going on, it doesn’t matter who they are. They must be exterminated.
WE ARE THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 29
15: INT. FACTORY STOREROOM.
FX: DOORS SWING AS DOCTOR AND CO RUN IN. DALEKS IN DISTANCE,
BUT NOT FIRING.
Seek! Locate! Exterminate!
In here! We’ll have to try to get out the way we came in.
Those things are trying to kill us!
Well done for spotting that, I can tell you’re a journalist.
Maybe we could push the shelves on top of them. There’s enough junk here to —
FX: DALEK BURST THROUGH STOREROOM DOORS.
Intruders located!
Oh no.
Out of the way, Frank.
Intruders must be exterminated.
(TO DALEK) Wait! (BEAT) Don’t you recognise me?
You are an intruder.
Oh, I’m far more than that. I’m the Doctor.
Physiognomy does not match records. Physiology does match records. You are the Doctor.
I knew you’d get there eventually.
You are an enemy of the Daleks. You must be exterminated.
WE ARE THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 30
Don’t you want to interrogate me first? You must have lots of questions you’re dying to ask. Out of all the times I’ve defeated you, which time was my favourite?
You must be exterminated.
Oh no you don’t, you... (PUSHING SHELVES) .. strike-breaker!
FX: FRANK PUSHES METAL SHELVES FORWARD.
Storage units collapsing! Retreat —
FX: LOUD CLATTER AS SHELVES FALL LIKE DOMINOS, BURYING DALEK IN
JUNK. IT TRIES TO MOVE, BUT IS STUCK.
My movement is impaired. (WHIRR) My weapon is unimpaired.
What? No. No!
FX: EXTERMINATION RAY.
SCREAMS, DIES
FX: FRANK FALLS AMIDST JUNK. SIDE DOOR OPENED.
He — he’s dead...!
Quickly, Serena. While the Dalek’s jammed in! (BOTH EXIT)
FX: SIDE DOOR SLAMMED. DALEK ATTEMPTS TO MOVE SHELVES AND BOXES
HAVE FALLEN ON TOP OF IT.
Doctor and human female are escaping. Unable to pursue. My movement is impaired. Assistance required!
WE ARE THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 31
16: INT. ZENOS TOWER CONTROL ROOM.
One intruder has been exterminated. The others have escaped.
I told you we should’ve used human guards.
One of the intruders has been identified. It was the Doctor.
Well, that changes everything, doesn’t it? Inform the Emperor. Now, if you don’t mind, I have guests to attend to.
Human dissidents are blocking the entrance to the plant, preventing distribution vehicles from leaving.
(AMUSED PARTING SHOT) Well, you know what to do about that, don’t you?
WE ARE THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 32
17: EXT. ROAD OUTSIDE FACTORY.
FX: AS BEFORE. DOCTOR AND SERENA ARRIVE, KEEPING QUIET.
That Dalek — it killed Frank with a death ray.
I doubt he’s the first. And he won’t be the last.
Is that all you can say?
Do you have a car?
What?
I need to get back to London. We know the Zenos Corporation is behind this. A friend of mine is attending a V.I.P. reception at the Zenos Tower.
You’re asking for a lift?
And on the way, I’1l tell you everything I know.
FX: FACTORY GATES UNCHAINED AND OPENED. A TRUCK DRIVES UP,
“SCAB!” ETC.
The trucks are trying to get out, they’ll never manage it.
Not without a fight.
FX: ALIEN SCREECHING VIA TANNOY, DRONING, WAILING SOUND, SHARP.
DOCTOR WHO CLIFFHANGER STING.
(OVER DIN) What the hell is that!?
Cover your ears. Cover them!
Alright.
FX: SCREECHING FADES. LORRY HONKS. STRIKERS YELLING MORE
FERVENTLY. HORSES SNORT AND STAMP.
WE ARE THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 33
(AGGRESSIVE SINGING) We shall, we shall not be moved [ETC]
(VIA LOUDHAILER) Clear the way! Move along...! (ANGRIER) Move along!!!
What’s going on?
Keep back.
(JEERING) Fascists! Filth!
(VIA LOUDHAILER) Clear the way! Move along! You lowlifes, move along!
(CHANT) Come and have a go if you think you’re hard enough!
(VIA LOUDHAILER) You hear them, lads?! Clear these animals! These subhumans! Move them along!
FX: POLICE YELL, CHARGING. HORSES CHARGE. STRIKERS START
BRICKS.
This is madness! What’s got into them?
What’s got into them indeed...
FX: A FULL-BLOWN RIOT.
What are you talking about?

ALEK: WE ARE THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 29
PURSUING: BUT NOT FIRING.
DALEKS: Seek! Locate! Exterminate!
DOCTOR: In here! We’ll have to try to get out the way we came in.
SERENA: Those things are trying to kill us!
DOCTOR: Well done for spotting that, I can tell you’re a journalist.
FRANK: Maybe we could push the shelves on top of them. There’s enough junk here to —
DALEK: Intruders located!
FRANK: Oh no.
DOCTOR: Out of the way, Frank.
DALEK: Intruders must be exterminated.
DOCTOR: (TO DALEK) Wait! (BEAT) Don’t you recognise me?
DALEK: You are an intruder.
DOCTOR: Oh, I’m far more than that. I’m the Doctor.
DALEK: Physiognomy does not match records. Physiology does match records. You are the Doctor.
DOCTOR: I knew you’d get there eventually.
DALEK: You are an enemy of the Daleks. You must be exterminated.
DALEK: WE ARE THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 30
DOCTOR: Don’t you want to interrogate me first? You must have lots of questions you’re dying to ask. Out of all the times I’ve defeated you, which time was my favourite?
DALEK: You must be exterminated.
FRANK: Oh no you don’t, you... (PUSHING SHELVES) .. strike-breaker!
DALEK: Storage units collapsing! Retreat —
DALEK: JUNK. IT TRIES TO MOVE, BUT IS STUCK.
DALEK: My movement is impaired. (WHIRR) My weapon is unimpaired.
FRANK: What? No. No!
SERENA: He — he’s dead...!
DOCTOR: Quickly, Serena. While the Dalek’s jammed in! (BOTH EXIT)
THAT: HAVE FALLEN ON TOP OF IT.
DALEK: Doctor and human female are escaping. Unable to pursue. My movement is impaired. Assistance required!
DALEK: WE ARE THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 31
DALEK: One intruder has been exterminated. The others have escaped.
ALEK: I told you we should’ve used human guards.
DALEK: One of the intruders has been identified. It was the Doctor.
ALEK: Well, that changes everything, doesn’t it? Inform the Emperor. Now, if you don’t mind, I have guests to attend to.
DALEK: Human dissidents are blocking the entrance to the plant, preventing distribution vehicles from leaving.
ALEK: (AMUSED PARTING SHOT) Well, you know what to do about that, don’t you?
ALEK: WE ARE THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 32
SERENA: That Dalek — it killed Frank with a death ray.
DOCTOR: I doubt he’s the first. And he won’t be the last.
SERENA: Is that all you can say?
DOCTOR: Do you have a car?
SERENA: What?
DOCTOR: I need to get back to London. We know the Zenos Corporation is behind this. A friend of mine is attending a V.I.P. reception at the Zenos Tower.
SERENA: You’re asking for a lift?
DOCTOR: And on the way, I’1l tell you everything I know.
HONKING HORN. STRIKERS JEER: “SCAB!” ETC.
SERENA: The trucks are trying to get out, they’ll never manage it.
DOCTOR: Not without a fight.
LIKE: DOCTOR WHO CLIFFHANGER STING.
SERENA: (OVER DIN) What the hell is that!?
DOCTOR: Cover your ears. Cover them!
SERENA: Alright.
SERENA: FERVENTLY. HORSES SNORT AND STAMP.
SERENA: WE ARE THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 33
PICKETS: (AGGRESSIVE SINGING) We shall, we shall not be moved [ETC]
POLICE OFFICER: (VIA LOUDHAILER) Clear the way! Move along...! (ANGRIER) Move along!!!
SERENA: What’s going on?
DOCTOR: Keep back.
PICKETS: (JEERING) Fascists! Filth!
POLICE OFFICER: (VIA LOUDHAILER) Clear the way! Move along! You lowlifes, move along!
PICKETS: (CHANT) Come and have a go if you think you’re hard enough!
POLICE OFFICER: (VIA LOUDHAILER) You hear them, lads?! Clear these animals! These subhumans! Move them along!
THROWING: BRICKS.
SERENA: This is madness! What’s got into them?
DOCTOR: What’s got into them indeed...
SERENA: What are you talking about?
DOCTOR: That sound you heard must’ve been some kind of mental conditioning, making them act against everything they believe in!
SERENA: The trucks are getting out!
SERENA: WE ARE THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 34
DOCTOR: And once they’re clear, the effect will wear off, everyone will go back to normal, and it will all blow over. Isn’t this what you came here for? To report on a riot?
SERENA: No. No, I didn’t want this.
DOCTOR: Then take me back to London.
DOCTOR: WE ARE THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 35
ALEK: (RETURNING) Ladies and gentlemen and Honourable Members, please forgive me for keeping you waiting. In the world of business, there is always a last-minute crisis.
ALEK: Anyway, you’re probably all asking yourselves, what this Zenos chap says is all very well, but alien worlds? Intergalactic markets? Isn’t that all a bit.. far-fetched? A bit... science fiction?
NILES: You said it!
ALEK: So let me give you all the proof you need. (TO DALEKS) Activate time corridor!
DALEK: Time corridor activated.
ALEK: Follow me through this archway, and I’1l show you a vision of the UK’s future in partnership with the Daleks.
DALEK: Guests will enter time corridor.
EACH: VANISHING WITH A WHOOSH AND CRACKLE.
ALEK: Please, one at a time, there’s no need to push!
CELIA: Typical, wherever you go, there’s always a queue. It’s the 1970s all over again.
NILES: Yes... I’m not sure about this.
NILES: WE ARE THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 36
MEL: Nor am I.
DALEK: You have nothing to fear. Enter time corridor! Enter!
NILES: Alright, no need to get your knickers in a twist! Mel, you can hold my hand if you like.
MEL: I can manage, thank you.
NILES: A liberated woman? Very well. Righty-ho, here goes.
TIME: VORTEX.
TIME: WE ARE THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 37
SERENA: But how could it make the police do that?
DOCTOR: It didn’t make them do anything. It amplified primal emotions and base instincts that are normally buried deep in the psyche. Fear. Anger. Hatred.
SERENA: But how?
DOCTOR: My guess is, a focussed beam of hypnotic suggestion.
SERENA: A “hypno-ray”!?
DOCTOR: The effect is temporary, but given sufficient exposure it would make you think like them.
SERENA: Like a Dalek?
DOCTOR: That’s what a Dalek is. A bubbling lump of hate. Would you mind if I used your car phone?
SERENA: Go ahead. Good luck getting reception.
SERENA: Who are you calling?
DOCTOR: My friend at the Zenos Tower. I’m calling her mobile.
SERENA: (IMPRESSED) She has a mobile phone?
DOCTOR: Yes. But she must be out of range.
DOCTOR: WE ARE THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 38
CELIA: Look at that sunset! It’s as if the clouds are on fire.
NILES: This place is like something from a Dan Dare annual! Everything that fellow was saying, about the Daleks... it was all true!
MEL: This is EFarth’s future?
ALEK: In a sense. This world is an example of the rewards of Dalek investment.
CELIA: You’re saying Britain could look like this? All glittering skyscrapers, palm trees and swimming pools?
NILES: (LAUGHS) Not much use in our climate.
ALEK: (LAUGHS) Oh, that’s easily fixed. We have weather control technology.
MEL: So what’s the name of this planet then, if it’s not Earth?
DALEK: Skaro. This is the planet Skaro.
MEL: Skaro!
ALEK: You’ve heard of it?
MEL: (SHE’S GIVEN HERSELF AWAY) No, I... no, of course not.
ALEK: Skaro is the Daleks’ homeworld.
CELIA: They live here?!
CELIA: WE ARE THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 39
NILES: Seems a bit of a waste if they sit in their tin cans all day. Or can they nip out and sunbathe?
DALEK: Alek Zenos. You are required.
ALEK: You must forgive me. Please, everyone. Refresh your drinks and enjoy the view. It’s a rare privilege to set eyes on an alien world!
EXITS INTO: WE ARE THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 40
ALEK: Well, what is it?
DALEK: The Emperor wishes to speak to you.
ALEK: I’m honoured.
DALEK EMPEROR: (VIA MONITOR) Alek Zenos. One of the humans you have brought here has been identified. As a companion of the Doctor.
ALEK: Really?
DALEK EMPEROR: (VIA MONITOR) The female known as ‘Mel’.
ALEK: Well, of course. You don’t think I’d allow her to come here by accident, do you?
DALEK EMPEROR: (VIA MONITOR) Explain.
ALEK: Isn’t it obvious? With her as our captive, the Doctor dare not interfere.
DALEK EMPEROR: (VIA MONITOR) You brought her here deliberately?
ALEK: As soon as I heard the Doctor was at large, I double-checked the guestlist. Now we have his companion, he will have no choice but to submit.
DALEK EMPEROR: (VIA MONITOR) The Doctor must obey the Daleks. Or she will be exterminated.
DALEK EMPEROR: END OF PART ONE
DALEK EMPEROR: WE ARE THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 41

elements.text: PART TWO
PRE-TITLES:
22: INT. KITCHEN.
FX: SERENA MAKING BREAKFAST. RADIO PLAYING INSTRUMENTAL POP
MUSIC — SOUNDS A BIT LIKE “PUMP UP THE VOLUME”.
Morning, Doctor. Sleep well?
No, but your couch was very good for sitting and thinking on.
I made you tea, is that alright?
Splendid, thank you. (TAKES TEA) Ow, hot!
Sorry. Still no word from your friend?
No. And it’s not like Mel to stay out all night.
She sounds fun.
FX: RADIO MUSIC ENDS. NEWS JINGLE.

Today’s headlines. The police are still holding several protestors after the riot at the UltraMega Tech factory. The government has condemned the violence. In happier news, reclusive millionaire Alek Zenos this morning announced his engagement to computer technician Melanie Bush.
(SPRAYS OUT TEA IN SURPRISE) Mel!
FX: SERENA SWITCHES THE RADIO OFF.
Your friend moves fast.
Don’t be obtuse, Serena. This is a message.
WE ARE THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 42
What sort of message?
A veiled threat, telling me that Mel is their prisoner and that they’1l kill her if I dare to oppose them.
You got all that from that report?
It’s how the Daleks operate. Take hostages, force their enemies to surrender. So that’s what I have to do.
What?
FX: DOCTOR GETS UP, PULLS ON COAT.
Surrender.
MUSIC: OPENING THEME.
WE ARE THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 43
23: INT. GUEST LOUNGE ON SKARO.
FX: BREAKFAST. DELEGATES EATING, CHATTING. WIND CHIMES AND
FOUNTAINS.
Good morning, Mrs Dunthorpe, Mr Bunbury. I hope you’re enjoying your breakfast.
(EATING) Full English, no foreign muck, quite right.
(EATING) Charitable of you to put us up for the night.
Not at all. Our pleasure. If you agree to our investment, you may, Of course, have your own luxury apartments here.
A holiday home on an alien planet! Certainly beats two weeks in the Algarve.
Although, of course, your own capital will be similarly transformed.
You intend to fill London with loads of weird-shaped skyscrapers?
Not sure I’d approve, monstrous carbuncles and all that.

Don’t worry, it would retain all its architectural heritage. No. I was thinking your run-down estates and boroughs could be converted into luxury apartments. After all, your guests will need somewhere to stay.
Sorry, what was that last bit? Aliens coming to Earth?
To do business. And enjoy your rich culture. London would be the greatest city on Earth, befitting its status as the capital city of Earth.
Now that I do like the sound of.
One question, though. What if we turn down this offer?
WE ARE THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 44
We would be disappointed, of course, and would have no alternative but to offer the same arrangement to other nations.
You mean, you’d go to the French? Or the Germans! ?
You are our first choice. With your membership of the European Union, NATO and the commonwealth, the United Kingdom is ideally placed to be the leading nation of Earth.
(TO HERSELF) The beating heart of a new British empire!
Steady, Celia. Let’s not sign on any dotted lines just yet.
Quite right. Now, I’m sure you’re keen to see more of Skaro. So, if everyone’s ready, shall we begin the tour?
WE ARE THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 45
24: INT. CAR.
FX: SERENA’S CAR PULLS UP. SHE SWITCHES OFF RADIO.
But why build a tower in the shape of a Dalek?
Isn’t it obvious? They wanted to get my attention.
So what’s to stop them shooting you the moment you walk through the front door?
My reputation. The Daleks will assume I’m up to something terribly devious — they won’t dare kill me until they know what at 2S 6
So you are up to something terribly devious?
FX: DOCTOR OPENS CAR DOOR.
No. But they don’t know that. (CLIMBS OUT OF CAR)
Well, good luck.
There’s a man you need to find, a colleague of Mel’s called Brinsley Heaton. He’s probably spending his Saturday at home. Here’s his address.
FX: NOTEPAPER HANDED OVER.
Why do I need to see him?
Ask him about Warfleet. He’s an expert. Goodbye.
FX: DOCTOR CLOSES CAR DOOR.
WE ARE THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 46
25: EXT. WALKWAY IN DALEK CITY.
FX: DALEK DRONE SHIPS WHOOSH OVERHEAD OCCASIONALLY. A UTOPIAN
WORLD. LIGHT SKARO WIND. GUESTS MUTTERING AND CHATTING.
Guests will halt and observe view.
FX: GUESTS ADMIRING VIEW.
In the distance you can see the Dramakin Mountains, just across from Lake Davien.
It’s like... glistening sapphires.
And what are those, in the sky? Personal flying saucers?
Dalek drone-ships. Pilotless craft, used for transportation and deliveries.
Was Skaro always like this?
A very good question. The Daleks have perfected terraforming technology and can adapt any environment and construct structures with astonishing rapidity.
(REALIZES) The Zenos Tower! That turned up practically the day after they got planning permission!
No unions, that’s the key. No strikes to hold things up.
Given that we offer full employment and prosperity, even a trade unionist would be hard-pressed to find something to moan about.
FX: LAUGHTER FROM GUESTS.
So are all the worlds that take up your offer like this?
Not quite. Other Dalek worlds specialise in manufacturing or service industries. But all are thriving, enjoying unprecedented economic growth.
WE ARE THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 47
I don’t know. In my experience, offers that sound too good to be true tend to be exactly that.
I’m sorry, I don’t follow?
You’re promising the people of Earth — sorry, the people of Britain — wealth beyond the dreams of avarice, if they agree to let the Daleks ‘invest’.
Yes, that’s it, in a nutshell.
So what’s the catch?
The girl makes a good point. What’s in the small-print?
I can assure you, you have nothing to fear, the Daleks abide by all — (trade)
FX: DRONE SHIP SWOOPS DOWN.
I say, should that saucer-ship be doing that?
No, I’m not sure — (it should)
FX: LASER GUN FIRE. GUESTS PANIC, SCREAM IN TERROR.
Under attack! Under attack! Exterminate! (CONTINUES UNDER
FX: DALEK RETURNS FIRE. DRONE SHIP APPROACHES.
Everybody, get under cover! For your own safety. Let the Dalek deal with this.
What the hell is going on?
Just a small... security matter.
A small security matter?! That thing’s shooting at us!
WE ARE THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 48
FX: DRONE SHIP DESTROYS DALEK AND STARTS LANDING.
No. It was only trying to kill the Dalek, not us.
FX: ALEK ACTIVATES INTERCOM. ALARM SOUNDS.
Calling all Dalek patrols. Attack on observation walkway nine. Send reinforcements.
(VIA RADIO) We obey.
Everybody, please, stay back, I promise you — (that)
FX: DRONE FIRES.
HIT
FX: ALEK FALLS TO GROUND. GUESTS REACT WITH HORROR.
Oh my word, it’s shot him. (FX: SLAPS HIS FACE) Alek! Wake up! Wake up!
FX: DRONE SHIP FINISHES LANDING.
Mel, maybe we should do as the chap said —
No, wait! Look! It’s landed.
FX: SIDE OF DRONE SHIP OPENS.
Statue-still! All of you! Or we’1ll shoot again.
We’re not moving, we’re not moving!
You two, the Earthgirl and the Earthman.
Do you mean us?
You’re coming with us.
FX: SHARI STARTS PRESSING BUTTON ON PORTABLE DEVICE.
WE ARE THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 49
Unless you want to get killed?
It’s not high on my list of priorities, no.
What do you want us for?
Explanations later. We have to get out of here.
Can’t you leave the way you came?
Not now the alarm’s been raised, they’d shoot us down as soon as we were airborne.
Then what, if you don’t mind me asking, are you doing?
FX: SHARI FINISHES PRESSING BUTTONS, HANDS OUT BATONS.
Here, hold these.
What are they? Relay batons?
Just don’t let go whatever you do. Ready. And energise.
FX: AFRID PRESSES A BUTTON AND A TIMEWARP BEGINS TO FORM, THEIR
BECOME INCREASINGLY DISTORTED.
(OW!) What’s happening?
Don’t worry. It’s just a portable time-warp generator.
A what?
FX: DALEKS ARRIVING, GLIDING ONTO SCENE.
Intruders in city. Exterminate. Exterminate. (CONTINUES IN B/G AS THEY APPROACH )
Prepare for temporal jump. Brace yourselves.
WE ARE THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 50
What? Where are you taking us —
Oh my word, oh my word —
FX: DURING THE ABOVE, THEY FADE AWAY, WHOOSHING, INTO NOTHING.
THE DALEKS ARRIVE.
I’m afraid you’re too late. They’ve gone.
Temporal residue detected. They have escaped through a timewarp.
And they attacked your ambassador-friend, Alek.
FX: DALEK EXAMINES ALEK USING SUCKER.
His injuries are not fatal. He will recover.
But who were those people? And why did they attack us?
FX: DALEK STARES HER DOWN.
They are enemies of the Daleks. They are Thals!
WE ARE THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 51
26: INT. DOWNSTAIRS RECEPTION.
FX: DOORS, DOCTOR ENTERS, WALKS UP TO DESK, PINGS BELL.
What, no reception? (ALOUD) I expected to be expected!
FX: LIFT DOORS OPEN. DALEK EMERGES.
You are the Doctor. Do not move! Do not move!
Why? Are you worried I might have something up my sleeve?
You are the enemy of the Daleks.
I suppose you could say that. Considering the number of times I’ve defeated you. It’s almost as if I can’t help myself.
Move into the elevator. Move!
FX: DOCTOR DOES SO, FOLLOWED BY DALEK, DURING:
Oh, I can move again now, can I? — “Room for eight persons or less.” Well, I suppose you count as persons. Or less.
You are to be taken to Skaro.
This lift goes all the way to Skaro?
There is a time corridor on the top level.
All for me? How kind. Shall I press the button?
FX: BUTTON PRESSED. DOORS CLOSE. LIFT ASCENDS.
WE ARE THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 52
27: EXT. SLAVE WORLD.
FX: FLAMING FACTORY CHIMNEYS, MINING MACHINERY, ENGINES,
COUGHING AND GROANING SLAVES HAULING TRUCKS AND UNLOADING ROCKS. CHILLY WIND. MEL AND CO APPEAR.
Oh my goodness, oh my — my breakfast! What happened?
You’ve been transported across space-time.
By tumble-drier, or so it feels. So where are we now?
Callico Nine. One of the Dalek slave worlds.
Shari. A patrol will be here any moment, they’1l have followed our time-trace.
You're right, Afrid, we should move. This way.
FX: THEY WALK ACROSS MUDDY DUCKBOARDS DURING FOLLOWING.
Sorry, did you say ‘slave world’?
This is the Daleks’ economic miracle. Take a good look.
Once this planet was like your Earth. Rich in natural resources, home to a civilised race. Well, fairly civilised.
And now it’s all factories and ruins and... chain gangs?
What happened here?
The Daleks made contact with one of the nations of this planet, offered to let them rule it.
(REALIZING) Great Britain.
That’s how they get a foothold. Then, gradually, over a period of months, they alter people’s minds.
WE ARE THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 53
Make them think like Daleks.
How do they do this, exactly?
Indoctrination? Brainwashing? The end result is a planet ruled by a nation that follows Dalek ideology, that acts like Daleks... That might as well be Daleks.
Happy to help the Daleks to asset-strip their world for all it’s worth. All its minerals, its fossil fuels. The favoured elite rules, while the rest of the inhabitants become a slave labour force.
And this is what the Daleks intend for Earth.
I told you it sounded too good to be true.
WE ARE THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 54
28: EXT. WALKWAY IN DALEK CITY.
FX: GUESTS MUTTERING AMONGST THEMSELVES. DALEKS MOVING ABOUT
B/G.
Attention. All guests are to return to Earth. Follow to temporal transduction chamber. Follow! Follow!
FX: GUESTS FOLLOW DALEK AWAY.
Alek? Alek, are you alright?
(WAKING) I’m fine, yes. Fine. What happened?
Those... Thals, they... disappeared. With Niles and Mel.
(GETS UP) Right. Daleks, do you know where they went?
Destination. Callico Nine.
You've informed the security services?
They were alerted while you were unconscious.
Efficient as ever.
It was my idea. But what would the Thals want with them?
Who knows? There are always those resistant to progress, who seek to turn back the tide of progress.
Oh, we have them too, we call them socialists. That’s what these Thals are?
They’re an irritation, but in any free society such as ours, some dissent is inevitable.
Report. The Doctor has been located.
IN
WE ARE THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 55
He has? Where?
He has entered the Zenos Tower and surrendered.
Sorry, who is this Doctor?
Another who seeks to prevent the Daleks expanding their trading bloc. (TO DALEK) Is he still in the Tower?
He is being brought here. He is to have an audience with the Emperor.
I’1ll go and fetch him, shall I?
He must be guarded by Daleks.
Of course, but I’d like to meet him.
FX: DALEK TWO GIVES HIM A SUSPICIOUS GLANCE.
You may escort him.
Thankyou. Now, Celia, I’m afraid it’s time you returned to Earth with the other guests —
Not on your Nelly. I want to meet this Emperor of yours.
What?
I haven’t come all this way to speak with the monkey when I could be talking to the organ-grinder!
WE ARE THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 56
29: EXT. SLAVE WORLD.
FX: CLIMBING ACROSS RUBBLE. THUNDER, WIND, RAIN.
So, Niles, what do you think of the Daleks’ offer now?
Excuse me, I haven’t signed up for anything. I thought this intergalactic market sounded fishy, we’re better off going it alone if you ask me.
Shari, where exactly are you taking us?
You’1ll see soon enough.
We haven’t been introduced, by the way. My name’s Mel.
We know who you are.
You do?
You’re a companion of the Doctor.
Oh. You know about the Doctor.
Of him. He’s helped our kind in the past.
‘Our kind’? What kind are you?
Thals.
You’re from this planet?
No. We’re from Skaro. Our forefathers were. Now the only Thals on Skaro are slaves.
I didn’t see any slaves when I was there.
WE ARE THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 57
Of course not. The people who clean the streets are kept out of Sight in a labour camp in sector twelve.
So why did you bring us here?
To show you this. And help the Doctor.
I don’t follow.
While you were the Daleks’ hostage he would be unable to defy them. But now you can both help us in our struggle.
You want to get Skaro back?
That world is no longer our home. We just want to free the slaves.
Ah, I’m not sure I want to get mixed up in local politics —
You already are. But you’re welcome to stay here, if you wish.
FX: THEY HALT. SHE PRESSES BUTTON, SHIMMERING OF AIR.
Oh my word, is that a spaceship?
What do you think? I thought Earthmen were intelligent.
But it just appeared out of thin air —
FX: SHARI PRESSES BUTTON, ENTRY HATCH OPENS.
It was cloaked. Well. Are you coming on board or not?
FX: DALEKS ON TRANS SOLAR DISKS IN DISTANCE.
Fugitives located!
Those things, they can fly!
WE ARE THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 58
Exterminate!
FX: EXTERMINATION BLAST, NEAR-MISS. DALEKS GLIDE CLOSER.
I’m coming with you.
Then get inside, Earthman.
FX: DALEKS CONTINUE TO FIRE AS THEY RUN UP RAMP. HATCH CLOSES,
TAKES OFF.
Enemy spacecraft ascending. Despatch drone-ships. Pursue and exterminate! Pursue and exterminate!
WE ARE THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 59
30: INT. TRANSDUCTION CHAMBER
FX: TIME CORRIDOR, WARPING, SHIMMERING, CRACKLING.
Time corridor activated. Doctor arriving.
FX: DOCTOR MATERIALIZES.
Hello there. Are you the welcoming committee?
I am your guard. Move!
FX: DOOR SLIDES OPEN, LEADING TO CORRIDOR IN DALEK CITY.
I say, you’ve had the place redecorated. I don’t like it.
(APPROACHING, WITH CELIA) Doctor.
Alek Zenos. Tell me. Was the company named after you, or were you named after the company?
Does it really matter?
Not particularly. I have an inquisitive nature. Which leads me to ask — who is this lady here?
Mrs Celia Dunthorpe. MP for Pottersbridge.
You’re a long way from Pottersbridge, Mrs Dunthorpe.
Alek has been kind enough to show me the Daleks’ home planet.
Very kind.
And I must say I’m impressed. If this is what Dalek investment can achieve, it’s just what the UK needs.
(INCREDULOUS) Dalek investment? So that’s what the Zenos Corporation is for. A Trojan horse!
WE ARE THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 60
We act as trade ambassadors for the Daleks..
Stooges, lapdogs, quislings. The Daleks can always find somebody willing to do their dirty work for them.
Doctor. You are to be taken to the Emperor. For interrogation.
Oh good, I have some questions for him too. Lead on, McDalek!
WE ARE THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 61
31: EXT. BRINSLEY’S HOUSE/INT. HALLWAY/INT. BRINSLEY’S FLAT
FX: SUBURBAN STREET. BUZZER PRESSED.
(VIA INTERCOM) Hello, yes?
Brinsley Heaton? My name’s Serena Paget. I’m a journalist.
(VIA INTERCOM) Haven’t I seen you on the telly?
I’ve come to speak to you. About Warfleet.
(VIA INTERCOM) Hold on.

NILES: I’m coming with you.
AFRID: Then get inside, Earthman.
SHIP: TAKES OFF.
DALEK: Enemy spacecraft ascending. Despatch drone-ships. Pursue and exterminate! Pursue and exterminate!
DALEK: WE ARE THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 59
DALEK: Time corridor activated. Doctor arriving.
DOCTOR: Hello there. Are you the welcoming committee?
DALEK: I am your guard. Move!
DOCTOR: I say, you’ve had the place redecorated. I don’t like it.
ALEK: (APPROACHING, WITH CELIA) Doctor.
DOCTOR: Alek Zenos. Tell me. Was the company named after you, or were you named after the company?
ALEK: Does it really matter?
DOCTOR: Not particularly. I have an inquisitive nature. Which leads me to ask — who is this lady here?
CELIA: Mrs Celia Dunthorpe. MP for Pottersbridge.
DOCTOR: You’re a long way from Pottersbridge, Mrs Dunthorpe.
CELIA: Alek has been kind enough to show me the Daleks’ home planet.
DOCTOR: Very kind.
CELIA: And I must say I’m impressed. If this is what Dalek investment can achieve, it’s just what the UK needs.
DOCTOR: (INCREDULOUS) Dalek investment? So that’s what the Zenos Corporation is for. A Trojan horse!
DOCTOR: WE ARE THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 60
ALEK: We act as trade ambassadors for the Daleks..
DOCTOR: Stooges, lapdogs, quislings. The Daleks can always find somebody willing to do their dirty work for them.
DALEK: Doctor. You are to be taken to the Emperor. For interrogation.
DOCTOR: Oh good, I have some questions for him too. Lead on, McDalek!
DOCTOR: WE ARE THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 61
BRINSLEY: (VIA INTERCOM) Hello, yes?
SERENA: Brinsley Heaton? My name’s Serena Paget. I’m a journalist.
BRINSLEY: (VIA INTERCOM) Haven’t I seen you on the telly?
SERENA: I’ve come to speak to you. About Warfleet.
BRINSLEY: (VIA INTERCOM) Hold on.
BRINSLEY: Come in, I’m through here. Mind the bike... Did you say Warfleet?
SERENA: I’m told you’re an expert.
BRINSLEY: What do you want to know?
SERENA: Everything.
BRINSLEY: Right. May take a while. Would you like a cup of tea?

BRINSLEY: ABOUT. DOCTOR LED IN.

DOCTOR: Delighted. (CALLS OUT) Hello there!
DALEK EMPEROR: Doctor.
DOCTOR: This is a great honour. For you. Allow me to introduce Mrs Celia Dunthorpe.
CELIA: Your... majesty.
DOCTOR: She’s a Member of Parliament, but I wouldn’t hold that against her. Now. Where’s Mel?
DALEK EMPEROR: Your companion’s life is dependent upon your co-operation.
DOCTOR: Yes, I thought it might be. But I’m not going to tell you anything until I’m sure she’s unharmed. Well?

DOCTOR: Yes. Much as I would like that to be true, you’1l forgive me if I don’t take you at your word.

DOCTOR: I’m showing it as much respect as it deserves. (TO EMPEROR) Tell me, what’s this I hear about you investing in Earth?
DALEK EMPEROR: It is our new paradigm. To extend our influence through economic power. The power of the free market!
DOCTOR: Doesn’t sound very Dalek to me. Whatever happened to conquering worlds? Subjugating the inferior species?
DOCTOR: WE ARE THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 63
DALEK EMPEROR: War is inefficient. Daleks do not need to resort to it.
DOCTOR: (TO CELIA) I hope you’re getting all this, Celia.

DALEK EMPEROR: The Daleks offer a future of prosperity. Of unlimited financial growth!
DOCTOR: You appeal to their basest instinct. Greed! And that’s what you’re offering Earth.
CELIA: Not the Earth, Doctor.
DOCTOR: What?
CELIA: They are very generously offering to make Great Britain Great again, as the Daleks’ favoured nation.
DOCTOR: As the Daleks’ puppets!
DALEK EMPEROR: We offer humanity the chance to realise its full potential. The Earth will become one of our core work-worlds, a centre for industry and commerce.
CELIA: It may be a hard truth to face, Doctor, but if we’re to compete in the intergalactic market, we have to attract foreign investment. Better the Daleks invest in us than take their money somewhere else!
DOCTOR: Good grief. Who needs Daleks when you have politicians?
DOCTOR: WE ARE THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 64

SHARI: Leaving ionosphere and entering deep space.

MEL: I didn’t think they’d give up the chase.

BRINSLEY: The consoles only came out a few months ago, but already there are thousands of kids playing at once.
SERENA: Through the phone lines?
BRINSLEY: Yes. It’s toll-free, paid for by the Zenos Corporation.
SERENA: The graphics looks better than most games.
BRINSLEY: It’s state of the art. I even opened the console up once. Inside, it was like nothing on Earth.
SERENA: Maybe it is.
BRINSLEY: What?
SERENA: It doesn’t matter. So, the game you’re playing, what’s going on?
BRINSLEY: A rebel ship has escaped from one of our empire-worlds, and we’ve been ordered to pursue it into the meteoroid belt.
SERENA: Where you’1ll destroy it?
BRINSLEY: Well, yeah. That is the whole point of the game.

DOCTOR: What about Warfleet?
CELIA: Warfleet?
DOCTOR: A game console distributed on Earth by the Zenos Corporation but manufactured by the Daleks.
ALEK: Actually, manufactured on another of our work-worlds, where the labour costs are cheaper.
DOCTOR: Let me guess. The games aren’t games at all. They’re a direct interface to the Dalek battle fleet.
DALEK EMPEROR: You are correct, Doctor. The humans that play the game are guiding Dalek drone-ships against our enemies.
DALEK EMPEROR: See now, a squadron of drone-ships in pursuit of a rebel spacecraft in the Callico star system.
CELIA: And when you catch up with them?
DALEK EMPEROR: They will be destroyed.
DOCTOR: But why? Why can’t you pilot your own spaceships?
DALEK EMPEROR: Our battle computers are logical. They lack instinct and intuition. Their decisions can be predicted.
DOCTOR: (LAUGHS AT THE MEMORY) Oh yes, I remember.
DALEK EMPEROR: We have found that human children are more effective than any battle computer.
DOCTOR: (HORRIFIED) What?
DOCTOR: WE ARE THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 68
ALEK: They are the most effective strategists. They have a genius for war. A genius we are happy to exploit.
DOCTOR: You’re taking innocent children and using them as your killers!
DALEK EMPEROR: They enjoy it. They find it amusing. Addictive. They are as good as Daleks!
DALEK EMPEROR: WE ARE THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 69
SHARI: Eagle Leader. Dalek drone-ships closing in. Heading into meteoroid cluster... Now.
FLEET LEADER: (VIA INTERCOM) Fleet preparing to attack.
MEL: What’s to stop the Daleks sending more drone-ships?
AFRID: If they do, we’ll be ready for them.
MEL: No. You won’t stand a chance. I know what they’re doing.
NILES: You do?
MEL: Those drone-ships aren’t being flown by Daleks. They’re being controlled by children, back on Earth. They think it’s alla great big computer game!
MEL: WE ARE THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 70
BRINSLEY: Commander Brinsley to all Hawk-ships. Prepare to fire.
SERENA: You're talking to the other players now?
BRINSLEY: Yeah.
BRINSLEY: Warning. All Hawk-ships. It’s an ambush. Rebel fleet detected!
BRINSLEY: Two Hawk-ships down. Three. Four. Last man standing. Reinforcements required.
BRINSLEY: WE ARE THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 71
DALEK EMPEROR: Reinforcements despatched. One thousand drone-ships warp- jumping to battle co-ordinates.
DOCTOR: What you’re doing is obscene. If those children knew the games resulted in real deaths, — (do)
ALEK: Would they still play them? Why wouldn’t they? War is a fundamental part of human nature. The finest moments in human history have been its great battles.
DOCTOR: Every ‘great battle’ has its casualties, leaving wives without husbands, children without fathers, mothers without sons.
DALEK EMPEROR: But there is no risk of human casualties. They pilot our drone- ships, free to kill without being killed.
ALEK: It’s the ultimate computer game, Doctor. Reality itself.
DALEK EMPEROR: For countless millennia the human race has fought amongst itself. To no purpose. But now they fight for us!
DALEK EMPEROR: WE ARE THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 72
DALEK EMPEROR: ON SCENE’ VIA SCREEN.
BRINSLEY: Just in time... reinforcements warping into gamma quadrant.
SERENA: There’s hundreds of them.
BRINSLEY: Almost the whole hawk-fleet. (LAUGHS) Oh, this is going to be a massacre!
SERENA: Wow. You really love this game.
BRINSLEY: Who wouldn’t? (FX: BUTTONS PRESSED) Oh no you don’t!
SERENA: What is it?
BRINSLEY: The rebel ship we followed into the cluster, it’s trying to slip away. No chance. Locking onto plasma trail!
BRINSLEY: WE ARE THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 73
SHARI: It’s no good, they’ve spotted us!
NILES: Can’t you do something? Open another time-warp?
MEL: We can’t. Warp-jump isn’t possible in a meteoroid cluster. We'd need to be in clear space.
SHARI: You know a lot about space warfare.
MEL: I have some experience.
AFRID: Shields down to seventy percent.
SHARI: We'll have to fly deeper into the cluster, it’s our only chance.
SHARI: BLASTS FROM PURSUING DRONE SHIP.
SHARI: WE ARE THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 74
ALEK: Now you see how the Daleks deal with insurrection!
CELIA: Quite right too. The rule of law must be maintained.
DALEK: Dalek drone-ships engaging rebel fleet. Enemy fleet suffering greater losses.

DOCTOR: Oh, Celia. You really are quite mad.
DOCTOR: WE ARE THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 75
BRINSLEY: Come on, you know the game’s up. There’s no getting away. Nearly got them.. Exterminate! (LAUGHING) Exterminate! Exterminate!

MEL: Can we contact them? Well?
SHARI: I suppose we could try. Why? What’s your plan?

DALEK EMPEROR: The rebel fleet is outgunned and outnumbered. They can only flee!

MEL: (VIA HOLOGRAM) Listen. The game you’re playing isn’t a game. It’s real. Real people are dying. You have to stop!

CELIA: (LAUGHS) Oh, well done!

DALEK EMPEROR: No. I told you she was alive.

AFRID: Shields destroyed. We’re defenceless!

SHARI: The communication is being blocked. They have no way of knowing that they’re participating in a massacre!
SHARI: WE ARE THE DALEKS by Jonathan Morris (FINAL) Page 80
MEL: Please. Whoever you are. You have to stop playing the game. Please. I beg you!
DALEK EMPEROR: She knows her communication is being blocked but keeps trying.
DOCTOR: That’s Mel for you. She never gives up, never surrenders.
DALEK EMPEROR: And now she will die. Watch, Doctor. Watch, as your companion is exterminated — at the hands of her own kind!
DALEK EMPEROR: END OF PART TWO

You are the enemy of the Daleks.
You must be exterminated.

What — (GRABBED) SERENA/BRINSLEY:
GRAB THE DOCTOR
